intro: Loroglossum hircinum subsp. formosum, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
